definition: to help oneself to (food)/to invite (trouble)/to court (disaster)
to have only oneself to blame (idiom)/to bring trouble through one's own actions
to court disaster (idiom)/to dig one's own grave
see 咎由自取[jiu4 you2 zi4 qu3]

sentences.english: This poor woman will go to her grave without ever achieving her goal.
sentences.chinese: 这个可怜的女人实现不了她的目标，她会自取灭亡。

sentences.english: So, you want to become the vent their disgrace and deepen himself.
sentences.chinese: 这样的话，你想的发泄就变成了自取其辱和加深痛苦。

sentences.english: Experience has taught us that to adopt an ostrich-like policy here is suicidal.
sentences.chinese: 经验告诉我们对现实采取回避态度是自取灭亡。

sentences.english: You have come to ruin because you are a man of blood !
sentences.chinese: 现在你自取其祸，因为你是流人血的人。

sentences.english: Don't compare yourself with any one in this world. If you compare, you are insulting yourself.
sentences.chinese: 不要将自己与世人比较，那将自取其辱。

sentences.english: Self barricading is to court one's own ruin.
sentences.chinese: 自我阻塞就是自取灭亡。

sentences.english: Is killed the student to have only self to blame, aftergrows up must for the Guangzhou black eldest children.
sentences.chinese: 被杀学生咎由自取，长大后必为广州黑老大。

sentences.english: The church at Corinth was self-destructing because it was filled with division.
sentences.chinese: 哥林多教会因为充满分争而自取灭亡。

sentences.english: I just hope that the traitor Gallas will make a fool of himself.
sentences.chinese: 我只希望叛徒加拉斯能自取其辱。

sentences.english: Yet the current mood of doubt is in many ways their own creation.
sentences.chinese: 目前各种怀疑情绪纯属他们咎由自取。

sentences.english: Procrastination, however, is the number one killer. Procrastinators self-destruct.
Gays, the Vatican believes, bring their misfortunes upon themselves.
sentences.chinese: 梵蒂冈认为同性恋者身遭不测是咎由自取。

sentences.english: He really had egg on his face.
He walks towards an imminent, self-given death?
sentences.chinese: 他正走向迎面而来的咎由自取的死亡吗？

definition: convenient/handy/easy/bento (a meal in a partitioned box)/lunchbox
I (first person pronoun used by royalty or nobility)
key information/instructions/it must be borne in mind
to pass by without showing interest (idiom)
to deposit/to store/to leave sth with sb
don't bother to see me out
Gentlemen! (start of a speech)/Ladies and Gentlemen!
